text: Hi, welcome back to my suburban garden. I'm Sheila and today I want to talk about herbs in your veggie beds So there are benefits to planning herbs in your veggie beds Not having a separate herb bed, but actually Spreading them out into your veggie beds. For example Sage it repels bean beetles, so I'm gonna plant a couple of these in with my beans Chives are supposed to improve the texture and taste of your carrots Basil which I already have in with my tomatoes Supposedly improves the flavor of your tomatoes peppermint Lavender and oregano all Attract pollinators to your bed, but if they also repel Pests from your garden from your beds. So that's the benefit of Having herbs planted in your veggie beds Please take a second it only takes second to like this video and subscribe It really helps the channel. I Appreciate it very much, but yeah plant herbs in your veggie beds now make sure that The herbs you're planting in with your veggies have the same soil and water needs as What's already planted in your your bed a quick Google search will tell you that Also, there are some herbs you shouldn't Things you shouldn't plant together and like I said a Google quick Google search I can't think of them at the moment, but you can you can find out With Google What you should and shouldn't plant together? But other than that, I would definitely I wouldn't have a separate or bed. I would definitely I in fact I'm gonna plant these here in a minute, so But this has been my superb regard now. See you in the next one
